contributor: Mark Willacy (Reporter); Palestinians are calling for United Nations peacekeepers to be sent into the Gaza Strip, after a massive Israeli raid in the Palestinian territory which left at least 13 people dead and more than 70 wounded.In a now familiar formula, the sides are offereing competing allegations.Israel says that it was targetting terrorists who allegedly use the town of Khan Yunis as a launching site for rocket attacks against a nearby Jewish settlement.The Israeli military's initial investigation concludes that only armed men were targeted in the incursion.Palestinians tell a very different story.They say that a hospital was hit and that innocent women and children died, with the incident cruelling yet another bid by yet another envoy to try to drag the sides out of the grinding violence.Middle East correspondent Mark Willacy reports.[Gun battle]Mark Willacy

title: Bush takes first steps to end dockworkers dispute
contributor: Tanya Nolan (Reporter); W Bush, takes the first steps to force an end to a crippling Us dockworkers dispute, an Australian union, the Australian Maritime Union has weighed in, dispatching seven representatives to stand with the American comrades on the picket lines.And that is fuelling a blazing row between the Federal government of John Howard and the Australian Maritime Union of Australia.It has suffered to back a dispute which has shut down operations at 29 western Us ports for a week, affecting around 200 foreign vessels waiting off the American coast, including three container ships carrying nearly 50-thousand tonnes of Australian produce.This morning, Federal Agriculture Minister Warren Truss has condemned the Mua's decision and told it to butt out of the dispute, in the interests of Australian trade - also calling on the Labor Party to call off the union.But neither the Union nor the Labor Party are paying any attention.This report from Tanya Nolan.Tanya Nolan
